author: Special Correspondent
text:
A proposed indefinite strike from April 11, called by the Southern Railway Mazdoor Union (SRMU), owing allegiance to the National Joint Council of Action (NJCA), has been postponed to July 11, in view of the Assembly elections in various States, including Tamil Nadu and Puducherry.

Announcing this at a press conference, SRMU general secretary N. Kanniah said two rounds of talks convened by the Cabinet Secretary and the Joint Secretary of the 7th Central Pay Commission Implementation Cell with NJCA office-bearers were not fruitful.

The railway employees decided to go on strike in support of various demands, including protection of existing allowances in the new wage structure.
title: SRMU puts off strike due to polls
